results.title: The High wall
results.creator_credit: Michael Road, Anti-Defamation League of B'nai B'rith and Columbia Foundation of San Francisco
results.brief_description: Traces a prejudice against immigrants from its beginnings to its development into a socially damaging outburst. In the dramatisation, Tom Gregory’s father, frustrated in his white-collar job, has contaminated his son with the anti-Polish feeling which lets out his repressed hatreds. Tom’s mother also influences the boy with her defensive hostility to different ways of life. Doctors and social workers become involved after Tom’s teenage gang attacks a party in the home of a Polish teenager. The social worker reveals the causes of the teenage riot.

results.title: The High jump
results.brief_description: Analyses the two dominant styles used in world-class high jumping, the Fosbury Flop and the Straddle. Includes aspects of training and exercises relating to the run-up, jump and flight. Written and narrated by Ron Pickering, edited by Peter Delfgou and photographed by Keith Taylor.

results.title: The Hiding place
results.brief_description:
‘The Hiding place’ makes frightening Freudian references to Enid Blyton’s children’s story ‘The Magic faraway tree’. ‘The Hiding place’ examines the fraught relationship between siblings and their mother.

‘The Hiding place’s‘ use of Flash animation and faraway tree theme lulls the viewer into a comfort zone that quickly evaporates as the viewer explores the work. The work features advanced use of net based interactivity.

results.title: The Hideout
results.brief_description: Portrays two children who face a dilemma when timber belonging to a neighbour is used by another child in building their hideout. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Hidden world: a study of insects
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Wolper Productions and Jack Haley
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how insects can be controlled to ensure human protection from illness. Shows how a bee tells other bees where to find flower nectar, and how winged termites are sent from one home colony to found new colonies.

results.title: The Hidden side of selling
results.creator_credit: Leon S. Gold, Roundtable Productions and Arthur Swerdloff
results.brief_description: Shows how sales personnel can increase their sales by learning how to deal with those customers whose reactions are hardest for them to handle. Creates an awareness of the psychological problems and hidden influences frequently encountered but often overlooked in selling situations.

results.title: The Hidden land
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and N.S. Thapa
results.brief_description: All along India’s northern frontier run the Himalayas, a formidable chain of snow-clad mountains and glacial valleys. Clothed in this cold and glittering mantle lies the kingdom of Bhutan, remote and mystic. This film is a study of this neighbouring kingdom, its people and their art and culture. Narrated by Berkeley Hill.

results.title: The Hidden grievance
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plant Supervisors Problems”.
Part of a six film series dramatising case problems met within industry. This film helps to make supervisors aware of the need for sensitivity in recognising and understanding underlying causes of an employee grievance in order to handle it satisfactorily.

results.title: The Hidden factor
results.creator_credit: Norman Laird, Tasmanian Government Film Unit and Don Anderson
results.brief_description: Alcohol in road accidents. The effect of alcohol and self-control; medical opinion estimates that the official figures on road accidents greatly underestimate the role of alcohol; the need for a scientific standard of intoxication; how the blood test helps police and protects passengers and others on the road; how the carelessness induced by alcohol frequently ends in tragedy. The story follows several people who combine drinking with driving.

results.title: The Hidden curriculum: attitudes
results.brief_description: One of a group of films about sex role stereotyping in schools. Examines the response of students and teachers to a female principal, and her own attitudes to her position. No other credits available.
